::Lord Elder::
   
  Elder decides to check out the sensors for himself. After viewing them he sees the ghost following them. He diesn't say anything as he is unsure of what it is. He just watches closely for anything that would give an enemy away.
   
  OOC: I am reminded of an episode of the original Star Trek by this. The first one with Romulans. Kirk has the Enterprise match the Romulan ship the same way.

Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
          Behind the Maximal shuttle a single ebony colored jet flew, weaving
around itself a complex sensor distortion patturn, covering itself in a
blanket of invisibility. 

As the shuttle flew the jet matched it move for move, like some evil
twin. So far it has made no effort to attack, relying instead on guile
and stealth. The time for the attack would be later, for the moment it
was intent to watch and follow!

Preston
(Nightrazor)

--- Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:

> ::Lord Elder::
> 
> He listened to the problem.
> 
> "Damn," he thought. They hadn't even reached Mt. St. Helen and
> something was already going wrong.
> 
> Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> The shuttle evaded detection by Relay as they sped towards
> Mt St.
> Helen. Night covered the region and Dinobot made sure to check
> navigation. He passed over the radar and thought he saw something. He
> checked back. Nothing. He grunted.
> 
> Dinobot: We may be followed. I will change course.
> 
> Jotunn: Followed? Well, are we or not?
> 
> Dinobot: I [grunt]... I couldn't tell for certain.
> 
> Jotunn: Too bad. We have to make sure. Chop, you're on it. Be subtle
> about it and make sure if anybody's in pursuit. We can't afford to
> lose this.
>
